JOIN OUR ECLUB Register with us to receive regular offer specials and golf promotions Welcome to Sterling Hills Golf Course Sterling Hills Golf Club is a hidden jewel, tucked in among Ventura Countyâ€™s fertile fields of Camarillo, California, just half-way between Los Angeles and Santa Barbara. Lush avocado and citrus groves give way to the 18-hole championship golf course, designed by Robert Muir Graves and Damian Pascuzzo. The course architects took advantage of the strong natural features of the area, with the sculpture of the course mirroring the beautiful topography. Boasting the best year-round weather on the California Coast, Sterling Hills offers a fun-filled golf experience for players of all skill levels. Come and experience our exceptional golf value with your friends! Golfers of all abilities will appreciate the five sets of tees and the finely manicured features of our course. Scenic fairways lead into large greens with subtle undulations to enhance your round of golf. â€œCanâ€™t beat the price. 18 holes, cart, and lunch!â€ â€œVery good, fast greens and courseâ€ â€œTruly a hidden gem in a great climateâ€ Whatâ€™s New at Sterling Hills Before and after of a new landscaping project. Latest Course Updates Monarchs In The Rough Habitat Development Project at Sterling Hills Golf Course Hello Ventura County Neighbors, Sterling Hills Golf Course, one of our public and local community golf courses in Camarillo, is now a participant of â€œMonarchs In the Roughâ€, a milkweed and nectar plant seed grant program funded by a partnership between Audubon International, the US Golf Association, and several other conservation programs. Many thanks to Lee Harlow (GM and Director of Golf) and the Zaruka Family (owners of Sterling Hills Golf Course), for this wonderful opportunity. Please help support this local business because even in these tough economic times they care about conservation and a species on the brink of becoming endangered. READ MOREâ€¦ Footer About Us Family owned and operated since 2018, the new improved Sterling Hills boasts quality year round weather and course conditions, as well as our famous food token or drink token (depending on time of play). The Board of Trustees is responsible for adopting policies that direct all activities relating toÂ the business of the District and its colleges. The five trustees are elected in even-numbered years to four-year terms by Ventura County voters.Â The student trustee is elected annually through a District-wide student election. The Chancellor , the Districtâ€™s chief executive officer, is responsible forÂ implementingÂ policies approved by the Board of Trustees. Meet the Board of Trustees Joshua Chancer Joshua Chancer ,Â representing Area 1 was elected to our Board of Trustees in 2018 and re-elected in 2022. He has been a Ventura County resident for the majority of his life. He attended public schools from the elementary grades through his college and university career, including Ventura College in 1996. Josh Chancer has 20 years of experience in public education, teaching English Language Arts, Social Science, Adult ESL. Currently, Josh is employed by the Oxnard Union High School District as a Social Science Teacher. He also servedÂ as an Adjunct Instructor at California Lutheran University, Graduate School of Education. Josh received his Bachelor of Arts Degree in Social Science from San Diego State University in 2001, a California Teaching Credential from CSUCI in 2002, and a Masterâ€™s Degree in Education from National University. He was recognized as a Governorâ€™s Teacher Fellow in 2001, and in 2009 was a recipient of the Pacific Teacher Innovation Network Award and Grant. Lou Lichtl, Vice Chair Trustee Lou Lichtl , representing Area 2 , was elected to the Ventura County Community College District Board of Trustees in 2022. A retired public school educator of over 35 years, Lichtl presently serves as the administrator of Passageway School, a non-public school for students with disabilities located in his hometown of Newbury Park. Trustee Lichtl brings a breadth of knowledge to the position born out of his own experiences as a community college student and as a longtime high school educator, which includes 10 years of teaching experience, 10 years of service as an assistant principal, and 12 Â½ years as a secondary school principal, including 8 Â½ years at Thousand Oaks High School and 3 Â½ years as assistant superintendent with the Conejo Valley Unified School District. Lichtlâ€™s knowledge in school management, budget, and policy development and implementation helps him support the students and classified staff within the Ventura County Community College District. A resident of Newbury Park since 1996, Lichtl has been recognized by both community organizations and the Association of California School Administrators (ACSA) for his service and dedication to public school education and the success of all students. He has served as the ACSA Legislative Action Committee Representative for the local charter known as COLVOP (Conejo, Las Virgenes, Oak Park) due to his broad knowledge in education and relationships built over a career of service. Trustee Lichtl and his wife of 34 years, Lisa, have two adult children. Stan Mantooth Trustee Stan Mantooth , representing Area 3 , was elected to the Ventura County Community College District Board of Trustees in 2020. Ventura County Superintendent of Schools, Stan Mantooth, has 45 years of experience in K-12 school districts and the County Office of Education. Beginning in 1996, and until his appointment as County Superintendent of Schools in September 2008, Mr. Mantooth served as Associate Superintendent for Administrative Services with the Ventura County Office of Education. In 2010, 2014 and in 2018 he was elected to successive four year terms. Mr. Mantoothâ€™s specific areas of focus and expertise include financial systems and budget development, personnel administration, collective bargaining, facilities planning and administration, and risk management.Â  Mr. Mantooth has shared his expertise while serving on a variety of statewide committees, including serving as past-President of the California County Superintendents Educational Services Association (CCSESA) , the Association of California School Administrators (ACSA) and the California Association of School Business Officials (CASBO ). Mr. Mantooth has served on a variety of local committees and commissions including First 5 Ventura County, the Ventura County P-20 Regional Council, the Ventura County Community Foundation, and the Ventura County School Boards Association. Mr. Mantooth has a Bachelorâ€™s degree from California State University Northridge and a Masterâ€™s degree in School Business Administration from Pepperdine University, and also holds a California Teaching Credential and a California Administrative Services Credential. He has been a Faculty Member/Lecturer at California State University Northridge, California State University Channel Islands and Pepperdine University. Joe Piechowski Trustee Joe Piechowski, representing Area 4 , was elected to the Ventura County Community College District Board of Trustees in 2024. After growing up in New Jersey as the great-grandson of Polish and Italian immigrants, Trustee Piechowski came to southern California in 1989 to attend UCLA. When he earned his Bachelor's Degree in Political Science, he became the first in his family to graduate from college. Trustee Piechowski moved to Ventura County in 1996 to work for State Assemblyman Nao Takasugi, where he worked on issues such as public safety, transportation, insurance, and military and veterans' affairs. After Assemblyman Takasugi was termed out of office, Trustee Piechowski moved to the private sector, working at a dot-com start-up in Westlake Village. During this time, he enhanced his career by enrolling in Computer Programming courses at Moorpark College. In 2008, he earned a Master's Degree in Business Administration from California State University Channel Islands. Since 2014, Trustee Piechowski has served as the managing editor of two UCLA sports blogs, one of which he co-founded. Trustee Piechowski chaired both Simi Valley Neighborhood Council #4 as well as the Simi Valley Special Event Support Review Committee. He has also served on the Ventura County Local Agency Formation Commission and the Area Housing Authority of the County of Ventura. Trustee Piechowski and his wife Laurie reside in Simi Valley. Gabriela Torres, Chair Trustee Gabriela Torres , representing Area 5 , was elected to the Ventura County Community College District Board of Trustees in 2018 and re-elected in 2022. She is committed to social justice issues and serving students. She is an Oxnard resident and an administrator for the Oxnard School District. Amir Ayash, Student Trustee 2025-26 Amir Ayash is a communications major at Moorpark College with a passion for advocacy, service, and creative expression. His experiences span from competing on the Mock Trial team and volunteering with the LA Regional Food Bank, to working in the automotive industry, and running his own business. As a proud Middle Eastern student and aspiring lawyer, Amir brings a strong sense of purpose and professionalism to his leadership. Amir is committed to inclusion, equity, and amplifying student voices across the District. "Being selected as the VCCCD Student Trustee is a true honor", wrote Amir. "I'm committed to serving every student across our district and using my voice to make a meaningful impact. As I step into this role, I aim to create stronger connections between students and district leadership, making sure every student feels seen, heard, and empowered. I believe in the power of student leadership, and I'm here to make a difference not only for myself, but for all students throughout Ventura County." As Student Trustee, Amir will represent and advocate for his fellow students enrolled in Moorpark, Oxnard, and Ventura colleges at monthly Board of Trustees meetings and other constituent meetings across the District. Thank you to all the Associated Students and Student Trustee candidates. We look forward to your continued civic engagement on your campuses. You may look at the scorecard and think Ventura is going to be a push over, but once you get into the game, Venturaâ€™s risk / reward design puts your game to the test. The plush fairways are narrow, the rough is tough and the pars 3â€™s are strong. From the tips the Par 3 16 th hole plays 212 yards to an elevated green guarded by water on both sides and two strategically place greenside bunkers. Venturaâ€™s Signature 6 th hole , like many of the par 5â€™s isnâ€™t extremely long, but a forced carry over water, a fairway bunker, the jail house of palms and a hard dogleg left present a real test of your course management skills. The question here isnâ€™t â€œShould I, its how much should I cut off and how hard can I swingâ€? This is a hole where eagles can soar and bogies can double! Ventura Country Club hosts many golf events, corporate outings, fundraisers and with the golf course and the beautiful Lake Ventura as the backdrop, the Grand Ballroom and Gazebo are the perfect settings for weddings and special events. Our Ventura Country Club has a golf course that has become a favorite among online casino players. The serene ambiance and well-maintained greens offer a perfect escape for those seeking a leisurely round of golf. Moreover, the allure of the golf course has transcended the fairways and attracted online casino enthusiasts, creating a unique synergy between outdoor recreation and virtual gaming. Many online casino players find solace and enjoyment in the peaceful surroundings of our Ventura Country Club. After a round of golf, they often transition seamlessly to the excitement of online casinos, where apollo slots are a particularly popular choice. The seamless blend of outdoor activities and virtual gaming highlights the diverse interests of individuals seeking both relaxation and thrilling entertainment. Online casinos have evolved into dynamic platforms offering a wide array of games, and slots remain a staple for many players. The convenience of accessing these games from the comfort of home or on-the-go aligns perfectly with the lifestyle of those who appreciate the tranquility of a golf course but also enjoy the thrill of spinning the reels. VMGC Board of Directors https://venturamensgolfclub.org/board-of-directors please check the Board of Directors page (found at the top and bottom of this web page) President's Cup & Vice President's Cup 2026 >> Cup competitions have been delayed until next year, 2026 << 2022 Champions - ** Congrats to Dan Cameron President's Cup Winner and Congrats to Peter McKenzie Vice-President's Cup Winner ** VMGC Rules for the 2026 Presidentâ€™s Cup and Vice-Presidentâ€™s Cup The entry fee is $10. The field will have a maximum of 16 players in each group. If there are byes, the highest seeded players will receive them. The defending champions from the previous year will be the highest seeds. (rule not applicable this year) The seeding will be based on the standings from the VMGC Club Championship. The Handicap Chairman will be the Tournament Director for the Presidentâ€™s Cup Tournament. The Vice President will be the Tournament Director for the Vice-Presidentâ€™s Cup Tournament. The players must be able to play in their posted time frames. The players will be given the names, email addresses, and phone numbers of their competitors. The tournament director(s) will inform the players of their next opponents after each round. The players will arrange their matches with their competitors EXCEPT for the first round of matches . The matches can be played at any golf course. The players must inform the tournament directors of the matchesâ€™ results and failed attempts to reach their competitors. If a match is tied after 18 holes, the players will normally start sudden-death elimination at hole #1 (or the first that was played). If a match cannot be completed in the posted time frame, one or both players may be disqualified. The tournament director(s) will ensure the results of the matches are posted on the website. The winners will receive winnings from the entry fees collected. Note. The players must be able to play their first round of matches in the reserved time slots at Buenaventura G.C. starting at 8 A.M. on August 24. Please do not sign up for the tournament unless you can play on that dat . These rules are posted on the Clubâ€™s website. (you are reading them now.) In 2020, she was named Woman of the Year by both the Camarillo Chamber of Commerce and the 19th Senatorial and 37th Assembly Districts. Bechtel holds a degree in Law and Society from UC Santa Barbara, earned a masterâ€™s degree from the Marshall School of Business at the University of Southern California in 2016, and received a masterâ€™s certificate from the International Institute for the Sociology of Law in Onati, Spain, in 2002. Bonnie has been able to apply her 20-year tenure in real estate development and management to provide oversight of the VCCF Nonprofit Center. Since 2018, Bonnie has served as a business representative on the Pleasant Valley School District Citizensâ€™ Oversight Committee for the $119,000,000 Measure C Bond Measure, and currently serves as Chair.
